description: AvsAn: Find the english language indeterminate article ("a" or "an") for a word.  Based on real usage patterns extracted from the wikipedia text dump; can therefore even deal with tricky edge cases such as acronyms (FIAT vs. FAA, NASA vs. NSA) and odd symbols.  (Requires .NET 2.0 or higher)
releaseNotes:
This release is source compatible with previous version 2 releases.
      Statistics are now up to date with the Wikipedia dump of 2014-07-07.
      Various improvements to the Wikipedia scanner and sentence parser have improved the accuracy of the statistics.
      Example changes: a->an andouillette; an->a honduran; a->an lcd; a->an obrogation; a->an unidiomatic; a->an unignitable; an->a xmas.
      Performance improvements: initialization overhead down to 1.3ms from 10ms; throughput up 14% to 43 million queries per second (measured on an i7-4770k @ 4.1GHz).
summary: Find the english language indeterminate article ('a' or 'an') for a word.  Based on real usage patterns extracted from the wikipedia text dump; can therefore even deal with tricky edge cases such as acronyms (FIAT vs. FAA, NASA vs. NSA) and odd symbols.  (Requires .NET 2.0 or higher)
title: AvsAn
